basics.name: Christopher Manloloyo
basics.label: NRT Trainee
basics.summary: I am an NRT DESCARTES trainee studying for a PhD in Electrical Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2026.

work.summary: Developed various software applications using a diverse toolset
highlights: Blockchain Developer in various chains with recent specialization in the Cardano Blockchain
Developed Blockchain NFT Marketplaces, Cardano Smart Contracts, and Rewards Schemes
Developed an Online Compiling API using various open source technologies
Integrated an Online Compiling API using various open source technologies
Developed micro saas prototypes and applications which include: social applications invoice builder, various APIs, VPNs, IPFS, and more.
Application and Game Development for Android, IOS, Windows, macOS, and Web.
Understanding of the Unity game engine and the application lifestyle
Understanding Frameworks like ReactJS, React Native, Flutter and many others.
Programming in C, C++, C#, Java, Javascript, Python, Objective C, Swift, Dart, and more.
Familiar with the full lifecycle of software products.
Heavily involved in programming over 25 prototypes for mobile/web apps. Both active and inactive projects.

work.position: Lecturer in the Electrical Engineering Department
work.summary: Lectured Electrical Engineering Courses. EE160, EE205, EE260, EE211, EE213
highlights: Additionally Lectured at Honolulu, Kapiolani, and Leeward Community Colleges (KCC, LCC, HCC)
190+ Credits of lecturing accumulated
Developed/Planned the Curriculum and Labs
Supervised Teaching Assistants and Graders
Courses Included below.
EE 160: Programming For Engineers (C & Python)
EE 205: Object Oriented Programming (C++)
EE 211: Basic Circuit Analysis
EE 260: Introduction to Digital Logic with Verilog
EE 213: Basic Circuit Analysis II

work.company: Naval Information Warfare Center Pacific (NIWC formerly known as SPAWAR)
work.summary: Engineer and PI on a variety of Projects
highlights: Designed and implemented AV/VTC systems (Crestron, AMX, Extron)
Designed and Implemented the Cisco UCS Virtualization Architecture
Proposed Managed and Executed Machine Learning Projects in Deep Learning
ML projects using shipping route data to perform action pattern recognition
Deep Learning to create a recommender system for watch officers
Designed and Executed Assessment Plans for renewable technologies
Deisgned an android application which allos dosimeter data through mobile devices and sends data over sms
Designed and Installed a communications network for the Maldivian Government

work.summary: Studied and Taught various Power Courses
highlights: Lectured the Power Systems Course EE 491. I had full control over lectures and labs for this course. Spervised by Dr. Anthony Kuh
Taught the Power Electronics Lab in Spring 2011. and the C programming lab in 2010

work.company: SPAWAR Systems Center Pacific, Pearl City HI
work.summary: Worked on Renewable Energy, low powered electronics, and electronic kits.
highlights: Analyzed electronics kits for teaching young students about electric power and renewable energy. Renewable Energies including solar, wind, and hydrogen fuel cells
Developed Robotics kits using 3D printing and servo/dc motors
Developed Robotics kits using 3D printing and servo/dc motors
Designed and built a prototype for teaching electric power and energy storage. This shows how to renewable energy can be generated and stored.
Analyze circuit designs for a low powered electronics application. The objective was to significantly reduce power on chip by utilizing the subthreshold region

Teach various languages and technologies.
Teach Circuit Soldering with hands on experience
Teach basic electrical components and Ohm's Law
Hands on 3D printing and simple Modeling
Arduino programming and servo motor control

volunteer.summary: Mentored the Waipahu High School FRC team and helped out with the Pearl City Team
highlights: Instructed students on how to use some basic machining tools
Helped students to understand basic programming
Participate and Mentor at the FRC Competition
